solution_line_template: The volume of water that is in the tank initially is {initial_fill_fraction_numerator}/{initial_fill_fraction_denominator}*{tank_capacity} = <<{initial_fill_fraction_numerator}/{initial_fill_fraction_denominator}*{tank_capacity}={initial_water_volume}>>{initial_water_volume} gallons.

When Daxton empties {empty_percentage_numerator}% of the water, he pumps out {empty_percentage_numerator}/{empty_percentage_denominator}*{initial_water_volume} = <<{emptied_volume}={emptied_volume}>>{emptied_volume} gallons of water.

The total volume of water remaining in the tank is {initial_water_volume}-{emptied_volume} = <<{initial_water_volume}-{emptied_volume}={remaining_volume_after_empty}>>{remaining_volume_after_empty} gallons.

Daxton then fills the tank with {fill_percentage_numerator}/{fill_percentage_denominator}*{remaining_volume_after_empty} = <<{fill_percentage_numerator}/{fill_percentage_denominator}*{remaining_volume_after_empty}={filled_volume}>>{filled_volume} gallons of water.
The final volume of water in the tank is {remaining_volume_after_empty}+{filled_volume} = <<{remaining_volume_after_empty}+{filled_volume}={final_water_volume}>>{final_water_volume} gallons.
